articles.description: On 21st August 1997, long before the arrival of streaming services and digital downloads, fans flocked to local record shops for a copy of the album, already engaged by its distinctive cover art.
articles.content:
It was the album that arguably brought the curtain down on Brit Pop, that short-lived moment when jangly, aspirational indie music dominated airwaves across the UK.

articles.title: 'What's not to loathe?' Jeremy Vine savaged by Jeremy Kyle in brutal take down of cyclists - Express
articles.description: JEREMY KYLE blasted Channel 5 presenter Jeremy Vine during Wednesday's Uncensored, as he launched into a rant about cyclists being on the roads while not paying for tax or insurance.
